org.lsmr.vendingmachine.simulator

Class AbstractHardware<T extends AbstractHardwareListener>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lsmr.vendingmachine.simulator.AbstractHardware<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CardSlotSimulator, CoinRackSimulator, CoinReceptacleSimulator, CoinSlotSimulator, DeliveryChuteSimulator, DisplaySimulator, IndicatorLightSimulator, LockSimulator, PopCanRackSimulator, PushButtonCodeInterpreter, PushButtonSimulator

    public abstract class AbstractHardware<T extends AbstractHardwareListener>
extends java.lang.Object
    The abstract base class for all hardware devices involved in the vending machine simulator.

    This class utilizes the Observer design pattern. Subclasses inherit the appropriate register method, but each must define its own notifyXXX methods. The notifyListener method is provided to minimize the work of subclasses.

    Each hardware device must possess an appropriate listener, which extends AbstractHardwareListener; the type parameter T represents this listener.

    Any hardware can be disabled, which means it will not permit physical movements. Any method that would cause a physical movement (potentially) will declare that it throws DisabledException.

      All listeners registered with this device are removed.
      void disable()
      Disables this hardware from permitting any physical movements.
      void enable()
      Enables this hardware for permitting physical movements.
      boolean isDisabled()
      Returns whether this hardware is currently disabled from permitting physical movements.
      void register(T listener)
      Registers the indicated listener to receive event notifications from this device.
      void setDisabledWithoutEvents(boolean disabled)
      Permits the disabled/enabled status of this hardware to be set without causing events to be announced.

    • Method Detail

      • deregister

        public final boolean deregister(T listener)
        Locates the indicated listener and removes it such that it will no longer be informed of events from this device. If the listener is not currently registered with this device, calls to this method will return false, but otherwise have no effect.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to remove.
        Returns:
        true if the listener was found and removed, false otherwise.

      • deregisterAll

        public final void deregisterAll()
        All listeners registered with this device are removed. If there are none, calls to this method have no effect.

      • register

        public final void register(T listener)
        Registers the indicated listener to receive event notifications from this device.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to be added.

      • setDisabledWithoutEvents

        public final void setDisabledWithoutEvents(boolean disabled)
        Permits the disabled/enabled status of this hardware to be set without causing events to be announced.

      • disable

        public final void disable()
        Disables this hardware from permitting any physical movements.

      • enable

        public final void enable()
        Enables this hardware for permitting physical movements.

      • isDisabled

        public final boolean isDisabled()
        Returns whether this hardware is currently disabled from permitting physical movements.
